result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Camren Lee Davis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Camren Lee Davis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Camren Lee Davis.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  State will file an order to produce the defendant to Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Camren Lee Davis.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Camren Lee Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Camren Lee Davis.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 3365 N 27th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Defendant Camren Lee Davis in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Camren Lee Davis in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 16CF4639. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Clementz. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Arraignment scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Mary Guimont
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No driving without a valid license.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Camren Lee Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Camren Lee Davis in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
